messages.content:
Apolônio de Tiana (c. 15 d.C. – c. 100 d.C.) foi um filósofo neopitagórico, professor e adepto do ascetismo de origem grega, nascido em Tiana, Capadócia (atual Kemerhisar, Turquia) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1). Ele viajou pela Babilônia, Índia e Roma, absorvendo o misticismo oriental [macaibaemfoco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).

A principal fonte sobre sua biografia é a "Vida de Apolônio" escrita por Flávio Filóstrato, um filósofo sofista, no início do século III d.C [gnosisbrasil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). Filóstrato baseou-se em diários e relatos anteriores, retratando Apolônio como um filósofo divino dedicado ao serviço da humanidade [gnosisbrasil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). Apolônio também é citado nas obras "A Vida de Pitágoras", do filósofo neoplatônico Porfírio, e "A Vida Pitagórica", do filósofo neoplatônico assírio Jâmblico [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [gnosisbrasil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4).

Apolônio era vegetariano e discípulo de Pitágoras [antoniofontoura](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3) [ufmg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [megacurioso](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [ecured](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). Ele adotou uma dieta vegetariana rigorosa, absteve-se de bebidas alcoólicas e praticou o silêncio por cinco anos, buscando a purificação do corpo e da mente [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). Ele enfatizava a pureza, a disciplina e a conexão direta com o divino [macaibaemfoco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).

Sua busca por conhecimento o levou a viajar por diversas regiões, incluindo Babilônia, Índia, Egito, Grécia, Itália e Espanha [gnosisbrasil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [ipeak](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5) [ecured](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). Nessas viagens, interagiu com brâmanes na Índia e sacerdotes no Egito, aprofundando seu entendimento espiritual e filosófico [macaibaemfoco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [ipeak](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [ecured](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [megacurioso](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3).

A ele foram atribuídos milagres e profecias, ganhando a reputação de mago e possível rival de Jesus, como um tipo de messias pagão [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [macaibaemfoco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [ecured](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). Apolônio ficou conhecido por realizar milagres, como trazer uma jovem de volta à vida [macaibaemfoco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). Em seu retorno à Europa, foi saudado como um mágico e recebeu honras de sacerdotes e pessoas em geral [macaibaemfoco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [megacurioso](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5). Ele se atribuiu o poder de prever o futuro e teria ressuscitado o filho de um senador romano [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).

A história de Apolônio atraiu seguidores devido às similaridades entre seus relatos e os episódios e a trajetória de Jesus [gnosisbrasil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [antoniofontoura](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [megacurioso](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5) [proximolivro](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7). Alguns estudiosos acreditam que Filóstrato tentou construir uma figura rival de Jesus em sua biografia de Apolônio [gnosisbrasil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [megacurioso](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [gnosisbrasil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4).

No contexto islâmico, Apolônio de Tiana era conhecido como "Balinus" e reverenciado como o "Mestre dos Talismãs" [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0) [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2) [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1). Várias obras alquímicas árabes são atribuídas a ele, sendo a mais influente o *Sirr al-Khaliqa wa-san'at al-tabi'a* ("Segredos da Criação e a Arte da Natureza"), onde é narrada a história de como Apolônio descobriu a Tábua de Esmeralda no cripta de Hermes Trismegisto [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).

search_query: What specific alchemical knowledge is attributed to Apollonius of Tyana (Balinus) in Islamic traditions, and what is the Emerald Tablet's significance in this context?

Okay, I will conduct Google Searches to gather the most recent and credible information on "Apolônio de Tiana feitos" (the deeds/achievements of Apollonius of Tyana) and synthesize it into a verifiable text artifact.

Apollonius of Tyana was a Greek philosopher and religious leader from Tyana, Cappadocia, in Roman Anatolia, who lived approximately from AD 15 to c. AD 100. [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) He is considered a central figure in Neopythagoreanism and was renowned as a miracle worker. [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)

**Life and Historical Context:**

*   Apollonius was born into a respected and wealthy aristocratic Greek family. [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)
*   His primary biographer, Philostratus, places his birth around 3 BC – AD 97, while historian Cassius Dio suggests a birth year around AD 40.
* [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)   He spent his life traveling and teaching in the Middle East, North Africa, and India.
* [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)   Apollonius adhered to Pythagorean principles, including vegetarianism, frugality, and the rejection of animal sacrifices.
* [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)   He entered the temple of Aesculapius during his teens and learned the art of healing.

 [theosociety](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2) [theosophy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3)**Miracles and Legends:**

*   Many legends surround Apollonius, with numerous reports of miracles performed as a wandering sage with his companion Damis.
* [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)   He was said to have performed miraculous cures, restored sight to the blind, cast out devils, enabled the lame to walk, and even reanimated the dead.
* [ugm](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4)   Other accounts credit him with prophecy and remote viewing. O [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)ne story claims he predicted Emperor Domitian's death in real-time from afar.
* [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)   Followers believed he underwent heavenly ascension after his conviction and death penalty for allegedly conspiring against the emperor through magic.
* [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)   Talismans made by Apollonius appeared in several cities of the Eastern Roman Empire in Late Antiquity.

 [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)**Sources and Writings:**

*   The most detailed source on his life is *Life of Apollonius of Tyana*, written by Philostratus in the 3rd century AD at the request of Empress Julia Domna.
* [britannica](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-5) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)   Philostratus claimed to have used the "memoirs" of Damis, Apollonius's acolyte and companion, as a source. O [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)ther sources include a book on Apollonius's youth by Maximus of Aegae and local knowledge from various cities.
* [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-6)   Philostratus's biography portrays Apollonius as a philosopher, miracle-worker, and defender of Pythagorean ideals. S [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)ome scholars believe the biography is more fiction than fact.
* [britannica](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-5)   Apollonius wrote books and treatises on science, medicine, and philosophy.

 [crystalinks](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-7)**Comparisons with Jesus:**

*   Philostratus's description of Apollonius's life and deeds contains similarities to the life and claimed miracles of Jesus.
* [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [aboutbibleprophecy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8)   Some scholars suggest that Philostratus's biography was an attempt to create a pagan alternative to Jesus and compete with Christianity.

 [aboutbibleprophecy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8)**Impact and Legacy:**

*   Apollonius's exceptional personality and mystical way of life impressed his contemporaries and had a lasting cultural influence.
* [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)   Emperor Aurelian spared Tyana from destruction after reportedly having a vision of Apollonius.
* [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)   In Islamic traditions, he was revered as "Balinus" and credited with discovering the Emerald Tablet and contributing to alchemical knowledge.

 [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)It is important to note that while most modern scholars agree that Apollonius existed historically, the miraculous accounts attributed to him are subject to debate. S [theosophy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3) [aboutbibleprophecy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)ome scholars believe that the oldest known record of Apollonius's miracles comes from Philostratus's book, written long after Apollonius lived, and may have borrowed details from the Gospel accounts of Jesus' miracles.
 [carm](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-9) [aboutbibleprophecy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8)

Apollonius of Tyana, known as "Balinus" in Islamic traditions, is a significant figure in the history of alchemy, largely due to his association with the Emerald Tablet [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0) [worldhistoryedu](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1). Here's a breakdown of his attributed alchemical knowledge and the Emerald Tablet's significance:

**Apollonius of Tyana (Balinus) and Alchemy in Islamic Traditions:**

*   **Master of Talismans:** Apollonius was revered as the "Master of Talismans" (Sahib at-tilasmat) in Arabic traditions [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).
*   **Attribution of Alchemical Works:** Several Arabic alchemical works, for which no Greek originals exist, are attributed to Apollonius of Tyana [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2). While most scholars consider these works pseudepigraphal, they reveal genuine currents of Graeco-Arabic Hermeticism [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Sirr al-Khaliqa (The Secret of Creation):** The most influential work associated with Balinus is the *Sirr al-Khaliqa wa-san'at al-tabi'a* ("Secrets of Creation and the Art of Nature"), also known as *Kitab al-'Ilal* ("Book of Causes") [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2). This 9th-century book expounds on the origins of the cosmos and situates alchemy as a science of cosmogenesis [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). It significantly influenced the alchemical school of Jabir ibn-Hayyan [rubedo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Discovery of the Emerald Tablet:** The *Sirr al-Khaliqa* narrates the story of how Apollonius entered the crypt of Hermes Trismegistus and discovered the Emerald Tablet [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). In this narrative, Balinus finds an old man seated on a golden throne holding an emerald tablet, and in front of him was a book with the secrets of creation [mountainman](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3).
*   **Philosophical and Alchemical Successor to Hermes Trismegistus:** Through this association with the Emerald Tablet, Apollonius becomes the philosophical and alchemical successor to Hermes Trismegistus [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).
*   **Other Attributed Works:** Jábir ibn Hayyán and other Muslim scientists considered Balínús a natural philosopher and attributed several cosmological, astrological, and alchemical treatises to him. Th [onelittleangel](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4) [crystalinks](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5) [mountainman](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3)ese include *Kitab al-Ahjar 'alá ra'y Balinas* and *Kitáb at-Talásim al-Akbar* (The Great Book of Talismans). The * [mountainman](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3)Kitab al-Ahjar* (Book of Stones) by Jabir ibn Hayyan contains a lengthy analysis of alchemical works attributed to Apollonius.

**Si [crystalinks](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5) [newworldencyclopedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6) [onelittleangel](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4)gnificance of the Emerald Tablet:**

*   **Foundational Text of Alchemy:** The Emerald Tablet (Tabula Smaragdina) became a foundational text of alchemy. It wa [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0) [occult](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8)s highly regarded by Islamic and European alchemists.
*   * [occult](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8)*Origins:** The earliest known versions of the Emerald Tablet are four Arabic recensions preserved in mystical and alchemical treatises between the 8th and 10th centuries CE. These [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7) [occult](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8) are found chiefly in the *Secret of Creation (Sirr al-Khalīqa)* and the *Secret of Secrets (Sirr al-Asrār)*.
